comment.author: 77345821@N06
comment._content: This aircraft is painted up as a flying advertisement for Trumpf chocolate company in Germany. The underside of the lower wings also bore the "Trumpf" name emblazoned along the bottom of this Fokker D.VII that had been modified into a two-seater in the postwar period.

comment.author: 74977163@N06
comment._content: The plane actually is DLWF D.VIIIa by Julius Hüffer, but no doubts about the pattern.

comment.author: 49487266@N07
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/74977163@N06] Can you please provide a bit more information on the DLWF D.VIIIa please?  Thanks!
comment.authorname: San Diego Air & Space Museum Archives

comment._content: @SDA&SM: Hello, just uploaded an article about the "Hüffer DLFW D.VIII" for you, see www.flickr.com/photos/37880184@N03/sets/72157632373825249/
